page.title: 13TRADITIONAL HOUSE BUILDING
page.content: In this area there is a rapid {population}increase at present. New{housing}is still mostly built in the traditional way although this method is not as cheap in terms of{economics} as building using the newer timber-framed style. First they dig the foundations which the stucture is built on.Then the main inner-wall is built out of breeze-blocks and the outer structure is built around the inner structure.The outer structure is built out of air bricks.There are also metal lintels over each doorway and window in order to hold either the ceiling or roof up. The outer wall has small bits of metal tied into both it and the inner wall in order to create a cavity which is sometimes filled with heat{energy}saving material.
